label.en: 24/25 S regular part 3 3 CP SV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 3. osa 3 EAP SV Eng

description.en: Final exam in IT Law is organized in three parts: during the academic year, students complete two studies on current challenges in IT Law and at the end of the academic year, students complete a written comprehensive exam in IT Law.
description.et: IT-õiguse eriala lõpueksam toimub kolmes osas:  õppeaasta vältel koostatakse kahe aktuaalse IT-õiguse sõlmküsimuse analüüs ning õppeaasta lõpus tehakse kirjalik eksamitöö IT-õiguses.

objectives.en: Master's Exam is designed to systematize the legal knowledge and skills acquired during the studies in IT Law, and to integrate them into a comprehensive understanding of IT Law. This objective will be achieved in the course of three assignments. In the first two, students complete studies on current challenges in IT Law. In the third, students complete a written comprehensive exam in IT Law.
objectives.et: Magistrieksami eesmärk on korrastada õpingute jooksul omandatud IT-õiguse alaseid põhiteadmisi ja- oskusi ning integreerida need terviklikuks arusaamaks IT-õiguse valdkonnast. Eesmärk saavutatakse kolmeosalise eksamiga, mille esimeses kahes osas valmistatakse ette aktuaalsete IT-õiguse sõlmküsimuse analüüsid ning kolmandas osas tehakse kirjalik eksamitöö IT-õiguses.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. have acquired essential knowledge and skills in IT Law;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. on omandanud IT-õiguse alaseid põhiteadmised ja -oskused;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. are qualified to resolve legal matters in IT Law;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab analüüsida ja lahendada IT-valdkonda puudutavaid õiguslikke küsimusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. are qualified to work in a group effectively and in an organised manner.
learning_outcomes.et: 3. oskab efektiivselt ja organiseeritult grupis töötada.

independent_work.et:
Essay. For details, please follow the Rules of Procedure for Conducting the Master's Exam in Information Technology Law.

Essay to be submitted electronically via Moodle.

description.et:
The Master's exam in IT Law is organized in three parts. The Third Part of the Masters' Exam is the Essay.
A: 91-100 points
B: 81-90 points
C: 71-80 points
D: 61-70 points
E: 51-60 points
F: 0-50 points

grade_preconditions.et: Please follow the timetable for the purposes of receiving the final result of the MA exam during the current academic year (2023/2024). Please note that only those students who have completed all the conditions of the curricula are allowed to take the third part of the MA exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
According to the Rules of Procedure for Conducting the Master's Exam in Information Technology Law.

The final grade of the MA exam is calculated on the basis of its three components. The weight of the components is the following:
* First Part - IT Law Lab: 33%
* Second Part - Legal Memorandum: 33%
* Third Part - Essay: 34%

debt_elimination.et: According to the Study Regulations (õppekorralduseeskiri) and the Rules of Procedure for Conducting the Master's Exam in Information Technology Law.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
